page.title: 04SANDALL BEAT WOOD,ARMTHORPE
page.content: A large part of the wood(about 9 acres, once part of Sherwood Forest) is used for recreation. Lots of people come to look round for wildlife and insects. Allotments on the edge of the wood where people keep poultry and grow food(nuseries) and, in the northern part a riding school, drawing many people, take 9_10 acres. 8 acres of the wood is a sports ground (rugby). {HISTORY:}The wood was given to the corporation in 1840_50. Then it was not a nature reserve, but still part of Sherwood Forest. There is now a railway line(built in 1910) running, where an old road was once used by coaches which would stop at the house (built in 1861). There was once a shooting lodge in the middle, near the house. This was used by Lord Fitzwilliam and later by the warden.
